title: Sampler, early 19th century
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on cotton foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, stem, satin, long armed cross, threaded running, Roumanian, fern, and buttonhole embroidery stitches on plain weave foundation
description: Vividly colored sampler in which the lower two-thirds is composed of flame patterns. The upper left corner has spot motifs, including a butterfly, dog, sheep, shepherdess, and various buildings; the upper right small floral bands.

exhibitions.title: Hella Jongerius Selects: Works from the Permanent Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, early 19th century.
early 19th century. Medium: silk embroidery on cotton foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, stem, satin, long armed cross, threaded running, Roumanian, fern, and buttonhole embroidery stitches on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer. 1981-28-341.
